org.lightningj.lnd.walletunlocker.proto

Interface WalletUnlockerGrpc.AsyncService

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    WalletUnlockerGrpc.WalletUnlockerImplBase
    Enclosing class:
    WalletUnlockerGrpc

    public static interface WalletUnlockerGrpc.AsyncService
     WalletUnlocker is a service that is used to set up a wallet password for
 lnd at first startup, and unlock a previously set up wallet.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default void changePassword(Walletunlocker.ChangePasswordRequest request, io.grpc.stub.StreamObserver<Walletunlocker.ChangePasswordResponse> responseObserver)
      lncli: `changepassword` ChangePassword changes the password of the encrypted wallet.
      default void genSeed(Walletunlocker.GenSeedRequest request, io.grpc.stub.StreamObserver<Walletunlocker.GenSeedResponse> responseObserver)
      GenSeed is the first method that should be used to instantiate a new lnd instance.
      default void initWallet(Walletunlocker.InitWalletRequest request, io.grpc.stub.StreamObserver<Walletunlocker.InitWalletResponse> responseObserver)
      InitWallet is used when lnd is starting up for the first time to fully initialize the daemon and its internal wallet.
      default void unlockWallet(Walletunlocker.UnlockWalletRequest request, io.grpc.stub.StreamObserver<Walletunlocker.UnlockWalletResponse> responseObserver)
      lncli: `unlock` UnlockWallet is used at startup of lnd to provide a password to unlock the wallet database.

    • Method Detail

      • genSeed

        default void genSeed(Walletunlocker.GenSeedRequest request,
                     io.grpc.stub.StreamObserver<Walletunlocker.GenSeedResponse> responseObserver)
        GenSeed is the first method that should be used to instantiate a new lnd
instance. This method allows a caller to generate a new aezeed cipher seed
given an optional passphrase. If provided, the passphrase will be necessary
to decrypt the cipherseed to expose the internal wallet seed.
Once the cipherseed is obtained and verified by the user, the InitWallet
method should be used to commit the newly generated seed, and create the
wallet.

      • initWallet

        default void initWallet(Walletunlocker.InitWalletRequest request,
                        io.grpc.stub.StreamObserver<Walletunlocker.InitWalletResponse> responseObserver)
        InitWallet is used when lnd is starting up for the first time to fully
initialize the daemon and its internal wallet. At the very least a wallet
password must be provided. This will be used to encrypt sensitive material
on disk.
In the case of a recovery scenario, the user can also specify their aezeed
mnemonic and passphrase. If set, then the daemon will use this prior state
to initialize its internal wallet.
Alternatively, this can be used along with the GenSeed RPC to obtain a
seed, then present it to the user. Once it has been verified by the user,
the seed can be fed into this RPC in order to commit the new wallet.

      • unlockWallet

        default void unlockWallet(Walletunlocker.UnlockWalletRequest request,
                          io.grpc.stub.StreamObserver<Walletunlocker.UnlockWalletResponse> responseObserver)
         lncli: `unlock`
UnlockWallet is used at startup of lnd to provide a password to unlock
the wallet database.

      • changePassword

        default void changePassword(Walletunlocker.ChangePasswordRequest request,
                            io.grpc.stub.StreamObserver<Walletunlocker.ChangePasswordResponse> responseObserver)
         lncli: `changepassword`
ChangePassword changes the password of the encrypted wallet. This will
automatically unlock the wallet database if successful.
